meanings.sent2: The gears interlock to make the machine work.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that connects or locks things together
meanings.sent2: The interlock on the seatbelt clicked into place.
meanings.sent3: The interlock on the suitcase seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: The interlock of the gears was the key to the clock's precision.
meanings.sent5: The interlock of the chains kept the swing in motion.

meanings.definition: To fit or be fitted together securely
meanings.sent1: The pieces interlock snugly, forming a strong bond.
meanings.sent2: The logs interlock to build a sturdy cabin.
meanings.sent3: The interlocking fingers of the gloves made them hard to separate.
meanings.sent4: Their lives interlock like pieces of a jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The interlocking bricks create a solid foundation for the house.
